content.question: A researcher is investigating the claim that the proportion of television viewers who identify one of four shows as their favorite is the same for all four shows. A <math alttext="chi square" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> goodness-of-fit test at a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> produced the test statistic <math alttext="chi square equals 8.95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>8.95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.03. Which of the following is correct?

choices.label: There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the test statistic is greater than the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value.

There is not sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the test statistic is greater than the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value.

There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than the significance level.

There is not sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than the significance level.
There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the test statistic is greater than the significance level.

content.answer: There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than the significance level.

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
